info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 10 at 1:52AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL TALLADEGA... RANDOLPH...SOUTHEASTERN CALHOUN...NORTHERN TALLAPOOSA...CLEBURNE AND CLAY COUNTIES THROUGH 245 AM CST... At 152 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Jacksonville to Oxford to near Barfield to 6 miles east of Goodwater. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Anniston, Oxford, Alexander City, Jacksonville, Roanoke, Heflin, Lineville, Ashland, Wedowee, West End-Cobb Town, Lake Wedowee, Cobb Town, Fort McClellan, Saks, Weaver, Munford, New Site, Hobson City, Wadley, and Ranburne. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for northeastern Alabama. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 400 AM CST for east central Alabama. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 800 AM CST for east central Alabama.
